title: Jersey City teen shoots himself in leg, police say
content:
A 14-year-old who told police he got shot early this morning may face charges after authorities determined he shot himself in the leg, Jersey City spokeswoman Jennifer Morrill said.
The Armstrong Avenue boy was been charged with possession of six bags of marijuana after police arrived at the scene, but he may face charges related to illegal gun possession and hindering an investigation.
Police believe the gunshot wound was self-inflicted because of gunpowder burns that were found on the victim's leg, according to a police report that Morrill cited.
The teenager told police that he was shot on Arlington Avenue in Jersey City but police could not locate a crime scene, Morrill said, adding that authorities continue to investigate the incident.
The victim was not cooperative with police and was taken to Jersey City Medical Center where he was treated for non life-threatening injuries, Morrill said.
